alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 6:55AM MST until August 24 at 9:16PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River Near Gila River at Calva affecting Graham County. For the Upper Gila...including San Carlos Reservoir at Coolidge Dam, Gila River at Calva. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Gila River Near Gila River at Calva. * WHEN...Until Wednesday Evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Agricultural fields flooded in Bylas and Geronimo areas. Portions of highway 70 near Bylas threatened. Highway 70 bridge approaches near Bylas threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM MST Tuesday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will gradually rise to 12 feet through tonight then more abruptly rise to 18 feet tomorrow morning into early tomorrow afternoon. It will then gradually fall to 15.0 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM MST.
